com.receiver2d.engine.graphics

Class Texture2D

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.receiver2d.engine.graphics.Texture2D

  • public class Texture2D
extends Object
    A Texture2D is a general-purpose texture useful for entities, skyboxes, and anything else that may need a texture. In contrast to an Entity, a Texture2D augments anything that is being rendered by specifying an additional color or image data to be drawn on by the Renderer, as specified.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Color bgColor
      The background color of the texture, which is rendered with first priority.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Image getRendered()
      The rendered image applies the dimensions of the texture to the original static image, and returns the "stretched" output.

    • Field Detail

      • bgColor

        public Color bgColor
        The background color of the texture, which is rendered with first priority.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(float width,
         float height,
         byte r,
         byte g,
         byte b,
         byte a)
        Creates a new Texture2D from dimensional and color values. The choice of floating-point dimensions rather than integer values is useful for rounding stored results from geometric calculations, rather than losing this information by saving it as an (int).
        Parameters:
        width - The _rendered_ width of the texture.
        height - The _rendered_ height of the texture.
        r - The red component of the background color [0,255].
        g - The green component of the background color [0,255].
        b - The blue component of the background color [0,255].
        a - The alpha component of the background color [0,255].

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(float width,
         float height,
         Color color)
        Creates a new Texture2D from dimensional and color values. The choice of floating-point dimensions rather than integer values is useful for rounding stored results from geometric calculations, rather than losing this information by saving it as an (int).
        Parameters:
        width - The _rendered_ width of the texture.
        height - The _rendered_ height of the texture.
        color - A color object (r, g, b, a) rendered as the background.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(BufferedImage i,
         byte r,
         byte g,
         byte b,
         byte a)
          throws IOException
        Creates a new Texture2D from a BufferedImage and color values.
        Parameters:
        i - The BufferedImage to use.
        r - A red value (0 through 255).
        g - A green value (0 through 255).
        b - A blue value (0 through 255).
        a - An alpha value (0 through 255), a 255 being completely opaque and a value of 0 being completely transparent.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(BufferedImage i,
         Color color)
        Creates a new Texture2D from a BufferedImage and a Color.
        Parameters:
        i - The BufferedImage to use.
        color - The background color of the texture to render.

      • Texture2D

        public Texture2D(R2DResource res,
         Color color)
          throws IOException
        Creates a texture from a resource.
        Parameters:
        res - The resource to use.
        Throws:
        IOException

      • setImage

        public void setImage(BufferedImage i)
        Sets the current BufferedImage of the texture.
        Parameters:

      • getRendered

        public Image getRendered()
        The rendered image applies the dimensions of the texture to the original static image, and returns the "stretched" output.
        Returns:
        A rendered version of the image.
